pullRequest.title: CATROID-193 Set Instrument to X
pullRequest.bodyText:
For this ticket to be properly implemented support in the midi library had to be created for it.
This includes:

A midi player supplied with a midi sound file directly executing midi commands to generate sounds. Because of this it is
possible to change instruments and execute similar midi operations. Up to 16 different instruments can play simultaneously.
A midi sound manager containing multiple midi players and methods to check and set values of them. Very similar to the
already existing sound manager
Some changes in the already existing parts of the midi library, including creating only one instance of the midi note player
and changing the path where created midi files are stored.
Added support in all sound related bricks for midi file playing

After these changes the new set intrument brick could be created.
Remaining problem: Not all instruments work
Ticket: https://jira.catrob.at/browse/CATROID-193
Your checklist for this pull request
Please review the contributing guidelines and wiki pages of this repository.

 Include the name of the Jira ticket in the PR’s title
 Include a summary of the changes plus the relevant context
 Choose the proper base branch (develop)
 Confirm that the changes follow the project’s coding guidelines
 Verify that the changes generate no compiler or linter warnings
 Perform a self-review of the changes
 Verify to commit no other files than the intentionally changed ones
 Include reasonable and readable tests verifying the added or changed behavior
 Confirm that new and existing unit tests pass locally
 Check that the commits’ message style matches the project’s guideline
 Stick to the project’s gitflow workflow
 Verify that your changes do not have any conflicts with the base branch
 After the PR, verify that all CI checks have passed
 Post a message in the catroid-stage or catroid-ide Slack channel and ask for a code reviewer

nodes.bodyText:
please avoid creating nested classes in Bricks,

move PickableMusicalInstrument to org.catrobat.catroid.content.bricks.brickspinner; and make it class instead of enum, which implements Nameable & Serializable
let this brick implement BrickSpinner.OnItemSelectedListener<PickableMusicalInstrument>

+
+		public int getValue() {
+			return value;
+		}
+
+		@Override
+		public void setName(String name) {
+			this.name = name;
+		}
+
+		public void setValue(int value) {
+			this.value = value;
+		}
+	}
+
+	public int instrumentSelection = PickableMusicalInstrument.values()[0].getValue();

nodes.bodyText:
since MusicalInstrument.getInstrumentFromProgram() is public static, please call it from the action.
once requested changes are implemented, no need to -1 anymore

you missed to add serialVersionUID attribute for this class, please just add this line
private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;

+public class PickableMusicalInstrument implements Nameable, Serializable {
+
